title: nightly: thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value'

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body: Nightly compiler panics when cargo check although cargo build works fine. Switching to stable resolved the problem . The only feature I was using from nightly was: #![feature(format_args_capture)]. Code is too big to display here. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.50.0-nightly (1700ca07c 2020-12-08) binary: rustc commit-hash: 1700ca07c6dd7becff85678409a5df6ad4cf4f47 commit-date: 2020-12-08 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.50.0-nightly ``` ### Error output ``` Checking beautyjob v0.1.0 (/var/www/beautyjob/main/_BEAUTYJOB) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', compiler/rustc_metadata/src/rmeta/decoder.rs:1565:75 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.50.0-nightly (1700ca07c 2020-12-08) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: thread 'rustc' panicked at 'already
